events.title: JTS High Holidays Webinars 2024: Seeking the Hiding God: A Personal Theological Essay
events.description: In this session, Dr. Eisen will discuss his rich, original, and moving work, which invites readers in asking what they actually believe about ultimate matters of faith and doubt.

events.title: Prozdor in Brooklyn
events.description: Kane Street Synagogue in Cobble Hill and The Senesh School in Carroll Gardens are thrilled to be partnering with JTS to launch an exciting new offering for Brooklyn Jewish 9–12th graders.

events.title: A Day of Learning for Our Hostages
events.description: Dr. Burt Visotzky, Appleman Professor of Midrash and Interreligious Studies Emeritusm at JTS, will be speaking at Shalom Hartman Institute’s full day of learning in memory of the six hostages murdered in late August.

events.title: Between the Lines: It Takes Two to Torah
events.description: Come hear Rabbi Dov Linzer—an Orthodox rabbi—and Abigail Pogrebin—a Reform journalist—for a lively, substantive conversation about their recent book.

events.title: Zionism: Today, Tomorrow, and Beyond
events.description: Join us for a two-day convening focused on Zionism.

events.title: Biblical Hebrew IV: Advanced Reading Seminar on King Solomon (Part I)
events.description: In nine live online sessions, we will read 1 Kings 1–5, focusing on the most difficult words and exploring multiple options for translation and interpretation.

events.title: Between the Lines: unalone
events.description: Jessica Jacobs joins JTS for a discussion of her recent book of poetry, an engagement with religious texts as an act of devotion to living fully in the world’s complexity.
